projects.name: fif
projects.description: Fast and lightweight game engine with editor (fifed) written in C++ with OpenGL.
projects.detailedDescription:
Fif is split into modules: core, gfx, input, imgui, native_scripting, lua_scripting, each independent of the other.

The rendering is so fast because the renderer is batching everything into a single draw call.

projects.name: game_of_life
projects.description: Conway's Game of Life game written in C++ using SFML library.
projects.detailedDescription:
The cells are rendered as a single Vertex Array.
Only the visible cells are renderered.
Logic is calculated on a different thread.
Vertex Array is being rebuilt when needed and on a seperate thread.

projects.name: billiards
projects.description: Billiards game written in C++ using SFML and GLM.
projects.detailedDescription: The balls are rendered as quads with 4 vertices, the trick to make it look like they are 3D spheres is to calculate normals of each pixel in fragment shader.

projects.name: chess
projects.detailedDescription: Most of the rules are implemented (legal moves, pawn promotion, checks), the only rules yet to be implemented are: checkmates, stalemates, en passant, castling.

projects.name: pjgen
projects.detailedDescription: Pjgen can create Makefile-based C or C++ projects, static web projects (HTML + CSS + JS) and python projects.

projects.name: rottlike
projects.detailedDescription: The prototype has a chat system and synchronized player movement/interactions.

projects.name: rgl
projects.detailedDescription:
Using RGL you can create games in C or C++ without the boilerplate needed by OpenGL and X11.

RGL has 3 examples on the github repository.

Keep in mind that RGL only supports Linux.

projects.name: redflag
projects.detailedDescription: With RedFlag you can easily add options/flags to an application.

Built with NextJS, MantineUI, NextAuth, Prisma, PostgreSQL.
Hosted on mikr.us.

projects.name: particle_sim
projects.detailedDescription: Particle logic is running on GPU using transform feedback.

projects.name: treegen
projects.detailedDescription: TreeGen can visualize trees, various fractals using L-Systems.

projects.name: battleships
projects.description: Online multiplayer battleships game written in Typescript using WebSockets and BunJS
projects.detailedDescription:
This is a battleships game that has all of the rules implemented.
You can play with your friend by creating a room.
The game has sound and visual effects for each action (miss, hit, sunk)

projects.name: game_of_life_ts
projects.description: Conway's game of life written in Typescript using Canvas2D
projects.detailedDescription: Left click to place a cell, right click to delete a cell.

projects.name: canvastein
projects.detailedDescription:
The prototype has a WebGL renderer and a Canvas2D renderer, for maximum compatibility.
The raycaster has fog rendering and a reflection rendering.

projects.name: isometric_grid
projects.description: 2D isometric grid renderer with 3D effect and animations (Canvas2D).
projects.detailedDescription: The isometric projection combined with the animations tricks your brain to think that this is a 3D scene.

projects.name: ttc
projects.detailedDescription: Simple yet fun to play tic tac toe game.

projects.name: chess_timer
projects.description: Switch-clock for competitive chess games written in Typescript.
projects.detailedDescription:
There are 3 time limits available:
  • bullet (1 min)
  • blitz (5 min)
  • rapid (10 min)

Press space to start or switch the clocks. You can choose the starting clock by clicking on it before the clocks are started.

projects.name: switchracer
projects.description: Typing game written in Typescript highly inspired by MonkeyType
projects.detailedDescription:
You can play SwitchRacer to check your:
  • WPM (words per minute)
  • CPM (characters per minute)
  • Accuracy (correct letters to all letters ratio)

projects.name: telestick
projects.detailedDescription:
Minecraft teleport-menu plugin with multi-language support (language is automatically detected for each client).

The GUI is scaled according to the player count, the players' heads have their skins in the GUI.
